item.title: Formula for $A^{-1}$ and Cramer's Rule
item.description: 17.1 Formula for $A^{-1}$ $A^{-1}$ can be given as $A^{-1} = \frac{1}{|A|}C^T$, where $C^T$ is the matrix of cofactors transposed. To verify this formula, we have to check that $AA^{-1}=I$, or $AC^T=|A|I$. If we expand the left hand side, we get $$\begin{align} \begin{bmatrix} a_{11} & … & a_{1n}\\ : & : & :\\ a_{n1} & … & a_{nn} \end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix} C_{11} & … & C_{n1}\\ : & : & :\\ C_{1n} & … & C_{nn} \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix} |A| & 0 & 0\\ 0 & |A| & 0\\ 0 & 0 & |A| \end{bmatrix}=|A|I \end{align}$$
